tweets.text:
RT @EvaFox: Elon Musk:

‚ÄúI do see a path to 100 gigawatts a year of AI powered space solar satellites. If you do a million tons of payload‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
Elon Musk:

‚ÄúI do see a path to 100 gigawatts a year of AI powered space solar satellites. If you do a million tons of payload to orbit per year with 100 kilowatts per ton, that's 100 gigawatts of solar powered AI satellites per year.

There's a path to get to a terawatt per year, then you want to make those AI satellites on the moon and use a mass driver.‚Äù

quoted.text:
Elon Musk: The lowest cost place to put AI data centers will be space ----

‚ÄúThe lowest cost place to put AI will be space. I think the case is a no-brainer for building AI, solar-powered AI data centers in space because, as you mentioned, it's also very cold in space. If you're in the shadow, then it's very cold in space, just 3 degrees Kelvin.

So you just have your solar panels facing the Sun and then a radiator that's like pointed away from the Sun, so it has no Sun incidence and then it's just cooling. It's a very efficient cooling system. 

So the net effect is that the lowest cost place to put AI will be space and that'll be true within two years, maybe three, three at the latest.‚Äù

user.name: Joe Lonsdale
user.description: I'm an entrepreneur, investor, & philanthropist. I founded @PalantirTech @Addepar @UAustinOrg @8VC & other mission-driven orgs. Bold policy @InstituteCicero

tweets.text: True

quoted.text:
I‚Äôve seen Elon‚Äôs work ethic up close for years, so I can say this honestly. Almost every time I have met Elon, he has been working and grinding hard. The first time I met him was in San Francisco around 11pm. He had already spent the entire day working at Tesla and then went straight to Twitter headquarters. It was late, but he was still fully focused and working. Months later, in October, I visited him again. It was late evening on a weekend, and once again, he was working. No breaks, no downtime. He was even working on his birthday. Last month, when I met him again, it was a Sunday evening and he was deep into xAI work.

This has been consistent for years. Seven days a week. He is driven by a mission to make humanity multi planetary. He understands the urgency and believes we are running out of time. Even with all the money in the world, he does not take vacations, does not own a yacht, and does not live in some fancy mansion. He lives simply, loves his work, and stays extremely disciplined. So anyone saying he had time to party on an island is telling a blatant lie.

tweets.text: RT @XFreeze: "For a while there, I was just sleeping under my desk, which is out in the open in the factory, for an important reason. And i‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
"For a while there, I was just sleeping under my desk, which is out in the open in the factory, for an important reason. And it was damn uncomfortable sleeping on that floor always when I woke up, I‚Äôd smell like metal dust

I stopped using the couch in the little conference room and just slept on the floor under my desk so that during shift change, the entire team could see me 

And that‚Äôs important because if they think that their leader is off somewhere having a good time, drinking Mai Tais on a tropical island which I definitely could have been doing and would much have preferred to do

I‚Äôm not actually a masochist, I think the thing is that since the team could see me sleeping on the floor during shift change, they knew I was there. And that made a huge difference" 

- ELON MUSK
